contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox religious building |building_name=St. Hedwig's Cathedral |image=Berlin, Mitte, Bebelplatz, Hedwigskathedrale 02.jpg |caption= |location=[[Friedrichstadt (Berlin)|Friedrichstadt]], a historical neighbourhood of [[Berlin]]-[[Mitte (locality)|Mitte]] |geo= |religious_affiliation=[[Roman Catholic Church|Roman Catholic]] |rite= |province=[[Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Berlin|Archdiocese of Berlin]] |district=1st [[deanery]] Berlin-Mitte |consecration_year=1773 |status= |leadership= |website=[http://www.hedwigs-kathedrale.de/ www.hedwigs-kathedrale.de] |architect=[[Georg Wenzeslaus von Knobelsdorff]], Jan Bouman ''the Elder'' (1747-1773), Max Hasak (1886-1887), [[Clemens Holzmeister]] (1930-1932), Hans Schwippert (reconstruction 1952-1963) |architecture_type= |architecture_style=[[Neoclassical architecture|Neoclassical]] |facade_direction=north-west |year_completed=1773, 1887 (dome), 1932 (interior),<br/>1963 (reconstruction) |construction_cost= |capacity= |length= |width= |width_nave= |height_max= |dome_quantity= |dome_height_outer= |dome_height_inner= |dome_dia_outer= |dome_dia_inner= |minaret_quantity= |minaret_height= |spire_quantity= |spire_height= |materials= }} '''St. Hedwig's Cathedral''' ({{lang-de|Sankt-Hedwigs-Kathedrale}}) is a [[Roman Catholic]] [[cathedral]] on the [[Bebelplatz]] in [[Berlin]], [[Germany]]. It is the seat of the [[Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Berlin|archbishop of Berlin]]. [[File:Berlin Hedwigskathedrale.jpg|thumb|left|Cathedral interior]] It was built in the 18th century as the first Catholic church in [[Prussia]] after the [[Protestant Reformation]] by permission of King [[Frederick II of Prussia|Frederick II]]. The intention of Frederick was to offer the numerous Catholic immigrants that had arrived in Berlin, especially those from [[Upper Silesia]], a place of worship. The church was therefore dedicated to the patron of [[Silesia]] and [[Brandenburg]], Saint [[Hedwig of Andechs]]. The building was designed by [[Georg Wenzeslaus von Knobelsdorff]] modeled after the [[Pantheon, Rome|Pantheon in Rome]] and construction started in 1747, interrupted and delayed several times due to economy measures. It was not until November 1, 1773 when the king's friend, [[Ignacy Krasicki]], then [[Bishop of Warmia]] (later [[Archbishop of Gniezno]]), officiated at the cathedral's opening. After the [[Kristallnacht]] pogroms that took place over the night of 9â€“10 November 1938, [[Bernhard Lichtenberg]], a [[Canon (priest)|canon]] of the [[cathedral chapter]] of St Hedwig since 1931, prayed publicly for Jews in the evening prayer following. Lichtenberg was later jailed by the Nazis and died on the way to the [[concentration camp]] at [[Dachau concentration camp|Dachau]]. In 1965 Lichtenberg's remains were transferred to the [[crypt]] at St. Hedwig's. The cathedral burned out completely in 1943 during air raids on Berlin and was reconstructed from 1952 up to 1963. == Burials == *[[Konrad von Preysing]] *[[Alfred Bengsch]], in the crypt *[[Lorenz Adlon]], in the old cemetery of St. Hedwig's *[[Bernhard Lichtenberg]], in the crypt == External links == {{commons category|St. Hedwig's Cathedral (Berlin)}} *[http://www.hedwigs-kathedrale.de/ www.hedwigs-kathedrale.de] Parish of St. Hedwig, Berlin (with mass-schedule and English pages) {{coord|52|30|57|N|13|23|41|E|region:DE-BE_type:landmark|display=title}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Berlin Hedwig}} [[Category:Churches in Berlin|Hedwig's Cathedral]] [[Category:Buildings and structures in Mitte|Hedwig]] [[Category:Roman Catholic cathedrals in Germany]] [[Category:Cathedrals in Germany]] [[Category:Basilica churches in Germany]] [[Category:Roman Catholic congregations established in the 18th century]] [[Category:Religious buildings completed in 1773]] [[Category:18th-century Roman Catholic church buildings]] [[Category:Roman Catholic churches completed in 1963]] [[Category:Buildings and structures in Germany destroyed during World War II]]
